text: Why did you change your name?
speech: In 2009, we changed our name to ChildFund International. We work with children of all faiths and welcome people of all faiths as sponsors, partners, employees and leaders here at ChildFund, so we wanted to make sure our name reflected that!

text: Why did you drop the word Christian?
speech: In 2009, we changed our name to ChildFund International. We work with children of all faiths and welcome people of all faiths as sponsors, partners, employees and leaders here at ChildFund, so we wanted to make sure our name reflected that!

text: Why are you no longer Christian Childrens Fund?

text: Why cant I access the ChildFund website?
speech: Hmm, sorry youre having trouble getting to our site! It works best with Google Chrome or recent versions of Internet Explorer, so I recommend using one of those browsers and make sure your cookies are enabled, too.

text: Why are the administrative costs so high?
speech: Good question. Were committed to responsibly spending every single dollar we bring in. And because we work hard to make sure our programs and services are efficient and high quality, were frequently recognized for our fiscal responsibility! Heres the breakdown: Of every dollar donated, 83.5 percent goes to programs for children, while 16.5 percent is spent on management, administrative costs and fundraising.

text: Do sponsored children move to the US?
speech: Through our sponsorship program, a sponsor helps support a child who lives in one of the 25 countries where we work. The sponsor has the option to visit their sponsored child, but the child doesnt come to the U.S. as part of the sponsorship. Check out our website to learn more about sponsorship [here](http://bit.ly/CFsponsor).

text: Can I email my sponsored child?
speech: Not currently. Our national and project offices arent equipped to handle direct emails sent to children. However, we do make electronic correspondence easy through our My Correspondence eLetters tool. All you need to do is log on to your Online Account and select My Correspondence to opt in for digital communications.

Not at the moment. Our national and project offices arent equipped to handle direct emails sent to children. However, we do make electronic correspondence easy through our My Correspondence eLetters tool. All you need to do is log on to your Online Account and select My Correspondence to opt in for digital communications.

Facebook is a great way to communicate, but our top priority is protecting the child and sponsor, so we cant help you connect through social media. Please keep writing and sending photos to your sponsored child! You can communicate via snail mail, or you can easily send a message online through our My Correspondence eLetters tool! Heres how: Log on to your ChildFund online account, select the My Correspondence tab and click the box to opt in for electronic communications. When you send an eLetter, it is printed and delivered to your sponsored child. Then a copy of your childs reply (and the translation, if needed) will be electronically posted to your online account, and well email you when its ready to view! If you have other questions about this, you can get in touch with a ChildFund team member here and they will get back to you soon.

text: Does the money go to the child?
speech: When you sponsor a child, you pay $33 each month. This money doesnt go directly to the child or family. Instead, its pooled with the monthly donations from other sponsors in the childs community. Then, local partners use it for programs or services that community needs most, like clean water, vaccinations or teacher training. That way, your money benefits the most children possible!

When you send money to your sponsored child, its converted into local currency and delivered to the child and his or her family. If you want to send a cash gift, or if you have questions about a gift youve already sent, you may contact our Sponsor Care Team by calling 1.800.776.6767 or by sending an email to Questions@ChildFund.org.

text: What happens if I send my child money?
speech: If you send a monetary gift, your sponsored child and their family will receive the money in their currency to use as they wish, so they can buy toys, shoes, food, a mosquito net or anything they may need at the time! To send a monetary gift, please contact our Sponsor Care Team by emailing Questions@ChildFund.org or by calling 1.800.776.6767. It will help to have you your sponsor ID number ready for quicker assistance!

text: How many children per family are sponsored?
speech: This is a tough question because so many children need help. We consider several factors when we enroll children into the sponsorship program, like the number of kids in the family and the familys income. Usually, one child in a family can be sponsored and your gift of sponsorship will help all of them!

text: Why wasnt I notified that my child moved?
speech: Im so sorry that we did not fully meet your expectations as a sponsor. We do send a letter to notify you if your child moved, and I hope you were able to read through that letter. Well do our best to explain. When a family decides to relocate outside of ChildFund program areas, they usually dont give much notice, which means we often arent able to let the sponsor know about the situation before the child moves. I understand having to say goodbye to a child is one of the hardest things we have to ask our sponsors to do, especially under these circumstances, so we try to include as much information as possible about the childs departure in your letter. We appreciate your commitment to your sponsored child, and we believe you created a meaningful bond which will continue to inspire both of you in your lives. If youd like to send a farewell letter, we will do our best to get it to your sponsored child if some of their family is still in the area. Thank you so much for your sponsorship, and I hope youll consider helping another child.

text: Why wasnt I notified my childs community got shut down?
speech: We understand your concern, and were sorry you didnt receive the letter that was mailed to all the sponsors who were impacted! Our goal is to help our local partner organizations become self sufficient, which is what happened in your childs community, thanks to your support! Were so happy the community is now self sustaining, but we also understand that the end of a sponsorship is hard for both children and sponsors. You can get in touch with a ChildFund team member here and they will get back to you soon with more information.

text: Why havent I received any letters yet?
speech: Waiting is always the hardest part, right? We get it! Let us explain how the letter process works, so you can get a sense of the timeline: Once your sponsored child learns they have a sponsor, he or she will write you a letter to say hello! If theyre too young or unable to write, a family member or local partner staff will help out. Then the letter will go to the country office and get translated (if needed) and sent to you! Its good to keep in mind that mail services to and from remote areas can be slow, so please allow up to 12 weeks for a complete exchange of letters. Thank you for sponsoring a child. The fun is just beginning!

text: Can I receive photos of my child?
speech: Great question. Yes, absolutely! If you become a sponsor, youll receive photos of your sponsored child and progress reports to keep you up to date on whats going on in your sponsored childs life. We also encourage you to keep in touch with letters, cards, and photos of your home, family, pets or anything else you want to share! Please check out this [page](http://bit.ly/CFsponsor) for more info about sponsorship.

text: Where can I share my story about visting my sponsored child?
speech: Wed love to hear more about your trip, and Im sure other sponsors would, too! text: How can I visit my child?
speech: Our staff would love to help you plan your trip, at least four months before your visit. To ensure the safety of both you and your sponsored child, well need to know the number of visitors who are, or will be, age 18 or older at the time of your trip. All adult visitors will need to complete and return three forms before the visit, for approval. After that, well work with you to help everyone have an incredible experience! You can get in touch with a ChildFund team member here to start planning your trip by calling 1.800.776.6767 or by sending an email to Questions@ChildFund.org.

text: Can I mail my child a gift?
speech: Definitely! Just make sure that anything you send is flat, lightweight and not fragile or able to melt. Bulky objects often create difficulties with customs officials, but a 6x9 or 8x10 envelope is fine to mail. Stickers, postcards or coloring book pages are great items to mail. Your sponsored child will be thrilled to get a present from you!

text: What happens if my child leaves ChildFunds programs?
speech: Well let you know ahead of time when your child is leaving the program and, hopefully, moving on to bigger and better things. We always do our best to make sure you have time to say goodbye or figure out other ways to keep in touch. Well also propose another child for you to sponsor, or you can choose another child to sponsor.

When you become a ChildFund sponsor, you help a child connect with resources and opportunities they need and deserve. Your sponsorship helps protect childrens rights to education, food, healthcare, and other necessities. And when kids are better off, they make their families and communities stronger too. You can learn more about the impact you can make through sponsorship [here](https://www.childfund.org/sponsorkids/).

text: What are the benefits of sponsorship?
speech: There are a lot of benefits of sponsorship, but Ill try to keep it short! Your sponsored child will benefit from having access to programs that help her or him grow up safe, healthy and educated. As a sponsor, youll receive ongoing correspondence from your sponsored child in the form of a letter. At ChildFund, helping other people makes us feel happy and fulfilled, and we thinks a huge benefit for our sponsors, too! You and your sponsored child will benefit from the connection and relationship youll have the chance to create an experience that can be rewarding and life changing for you both. Learn more about sponsorship [here](https://www.childfund.org/sponsorkids/).

text: What tangible benefits does my child receive through sponsorship?
speech: Good question! We collaborate with local organizations in all the communities where we work to find out what specific services people living there need. Usually, these services include projects that promote access to health care, safe water, nutrition, education and training programs. Since I dont know your sponsored child, I cant give you exact details, but youll learn the specifics of our work in your sponsored childs community through annual progress reports and direct communication from the child!

text: What is the difference between sponsorship funds and direct gifts to my child?
speech: Good question! Sponsorship funds go to local partner organizations in the communities where we work, so that money goes toward the specific needs of your sponsored childs community, like helping to build a school or upgrading a water source that your sponsored child uses every day. A direct gift gets changed into the right currency and then goes to the child and his or her family to use, so families might buy shoes for their child, food or household furniture or anything they may need at the time!

text: How long does my sponsorship last?
speech: Your sponsorship lasts as long as you keep up your monthly giving and the child stays in our programs and in a community where we work. Most children graduate from our programs between the ages of 18 and 24, depending on whether or not they stay in our programs or continue their education. If a child moves away from his local community, gets married or stops participating in our programs, we may have to prematurely end the childs enrollment.

Thats an important question, and Im glad you asked. When you become a ChildFund sponsor, you help fight poverty by giving a child a chance at a life they deserve. When children have access to better opportunities, they make their families and communities stronger, too. Through our local partners and with the help of parents, teachers and local governments, your sponsorship helps protect childrens rights to education, food, clean water, health care and other necessities. Sponsorship is a relationship, a connection, a way to be a global citizen. We love it, and we think you will, too.

Good question! Right now, 570 million children are living in extreme poverty. That means their families cant always afford basic needs like food and water, or basic rights like health care and education. Because of their circumstances, these children are also more vulnerable to child protection issues like violence, child labor, and child marriage. We work with local partner organizations, focusing on the specific developmental and protection needs of children at each stage of life. And we make sure our programs and services are tailored to address the unique needs of each community, helping to create positive long term change and opportunities for children to break free from the cycle of poverty and lead fulfilling lives, as we all deserve. Please take a look at our [website]: https://www.childfund.org to learn more details about our work.

text: How do I change my credit card?
speech: Heres how you can update your credit card information:   1. Log in to your online account [here](https://www.childfund.org/Authenticate/Login.aspx)   2. Click on the My Giving tab.   3. Under the Payment Information section, click the orange Add Funding Source option.  4. Input your new funding source information and click Add.  5. After the new funding source has been added, go back to the My Giving tab and click on the orange Update option under the Scheduled Giving section.  6. Choose the new funding source and payment frequency and click Update.

text: How can I visit my sponsored child?
speech: Our staff would love to help you plan your trip, at least four months before your visit. To ensure the safety of both you and your sponsored child, well need to know the number of visitors who are, or will be, age 18 or older at the time of your trip. All adult visitors will need to complete and return three forms before the visit, for approval. After that, well work with you to help everyone have an incredible experience! You can get in touch with a ChildFund team member here to start planning your trip by calling 1.800.776.6767 or by sending an email to Questions@ChildFund.org.

Yes, you can pay online! We accept Visa, MasterCard, Discover and American Express. You can choose either one time only or recurring donations. If you would like to make recurring donations, you can arrange for automatic payments to be drawn from your checking or savings accounts. Your donation request will be processed on the evening of the date that you have selected, or on the next business day. Once your donation has been processed, you will be able to view the updated information on our website.

text: My  child s community got shut down and I wasnt notified.
speech: We understand your concern. Our goal is to help the local partner organizations through which we work in communities to become self sufficient, which is what has happened in your childs community, thanks to your continued support. While we are happy the community is now self sustaining, we also understand that the end of a sponsorship is difficult for both children and sponsors. Our Sponsor Care team can contact the National Office to see if there is any way that your letter and gift can be delivered. Please give them a call at 1.800.776.6767, or email them at questions@childfund.org. Again, were so grateful for your support.

Were glad to hear youd like to send your sponsored child mail. Oftentimes, bulky objects create difficulties with customs officials, but a 6x9 or 8x10 envelope is fine to mail. Just make sure that anything you include is flat, lightweight and not easily broken. Please also avoid items that can melt. We suggest that you avoid sending any sort of bulky items to reduce theft and the possibility of prohibitive taxes or fees.

ChildFund was first known as Chinas Children Fund, later as Christian Childrens Fund, and now we are known as ChildFund International.
